DOC.brief_summary: This study do find whether umbilical cord milking ( UCM ) least good good delay cord clamping ( DCC ) reduce bleed brain prevent death premature newborn . The investigator study short long term outcomes infant deliver 32 week gestation receive either UCM DCC .
DOC.brief_title: Premature Infants Receiving Milking Delayed Cord Clamping : PREMOD2
DOC.detailed_description: Aim 1 . Compare incidence severe intraventricular hemorrhage ( IVH ) and/or death premature newborns < 32 week gestational age ( GA ) deliver C/S receive UCM receive DCC . Hypothesis1 : First demonstrate infant UCM group inferior DCC group ( reject H10 ) . Hypothesis2 : If H1 true , demonstrate low incidence severe IVH and/or death UCM infant compare DCC . Aim 2 . Compare safety efficacy profile premature newborn < 32 week GA deliver C/S receive UCM vs. DCC hospitalization 24 month correct age . Hypothesis3 : UCM group decrease need resuscitation intervention sub-study , improve early cardiac cerebral hemodynamics first 24 hour difference bilirubin polycythemia compare DCC . Hypothesis4 : Infants UCM group improve long term outcomes less neurodevelopmental impairment ( NDI ) 24 month correct age compare DCC . Aim 3 ( exploratory ) . To compare outcomes premature newborn < 32 week GA deliver C/S ( Cesarean section ) ( Aims 1 2 ) bear V/D ( vaginal delivery ) receive UCM DCC .
DOC.criteria: 23 31 +6 Gestational age Multiples unless monochorionic Congenital anomaly Major cardiac defect Placental abruption previa hemorrhage Cord prolapse Hydrops Bleeding Accreta Monochorionic multiple ( i.e . Di/Mo Mo/Mo twin ) Fetal maternal risk ( i.e . compromise ) Maternal HIV , Hepatitis B C Parents decline study Unlikely return 2 yr Follow Up
